verses.kjv: And Jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, Esau came, and with him four hundred men. And he divided the children unto Leah, and unto Rachel, and unto the two handmaids.
verses.ct: Jacob looked up and saw Esau approaching with four hundred men. So he separated the children among Leah, Rachel, and the two servant women.

verses.kjv: And he put the handmaids and their children foremost, and Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph hindermost.
verses.ct: He placed the servant women and their children at the front, Leah and her children behind them, and Rachel and Joseph at the very back.

verses.kjv: And he passed over before them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.
verses.ct: He himself went ahead of them all, bowing down to the ground seven times as he drew close to his brother.

verses.kjv: And Esau ran to meet him, and embraced him, and fell on his neck, and kissed him: and they wept.
verses.ct: Esau rushed toward him, threw his arms around him, hugged his neck, and kissed him. Both of them cried.

verses.kjv: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, Who are those with thee? And he said, The children which God hath graciously given thy servant.
verses.ct: Then Esau looked up and noticed the women and children. He asked, "Who are all these people with you?" Jacob replied, "They are the children that God has graciously given to your servant."

verses.kjv: Then the handmaidens came near, they and their children, and they bowed themselves.
verses.ct: The servant women came forward with their children and bowed down.

verses.kjv: And Leah also with her children came near, and bowed themselves: and after came Joseph near and Rachel, and they bowed themselves.
verses.ct: Leah also came forward with her children and bowed down. Then Joseph and Rachel approached and bowed down as well.

verses.kjv: And he said, What meanest thou by all this drove which I met? And he said, These are to find grace in the sight of my lord.
verses.ct: Esau asked, "What was the purpose of all those herds I encountered along the way?" Jacob answered, "They were meant to find grace in the eyes of my lord."

verses.kjv: And Esau said, I have enough, my brother; keep that thou hast unto thyself.
verses.ct: Esau said, "I already have plenty, my brother. Keep what belongs to you."

verses.kjv: And Jacob said, Nay, I pray thee, if now I have found grace in thy sight, then receive my present at my hand: for therefore I have seen thy face, as though I had seen the face of God, and thou wast pleased with me.
verses.ct: But Jacob said, "No, please — if I have found grace in your sight, then accept my gift from my hand. For seeing your face has been like seeing the face of God, since you have received me so favorably."

verses.kjv: Take, I pray thee, my blessing that is brought to thee; because God hath dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough. And he urged him, and he took it.
verses.ct: "Please take my blessing that was brought to you, because God has dealt graciously with me and I have enough." Jacob kept insisting, so Esau accepted it.

verses.kjv: And he said, Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before thee.
verses.ct: Esau said, "Let's set out on our way together, and I will travel ahead of you."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, My lord knoweth that the children are tender, and the flocks and herds with young are with me: and if men should overdrive them one day, all the flock will die.
verses.ct: But Jacob replied, "My lord knows that the children are young, and I have nursing flocks and herds to care for. If they are driven too hard for even a single day, all the animals will die."

verses.kjv: Let my lord, I pray thee, pass over before his servant: and I will lead on softly, according as the cattle that goeth before me and the children be able to endure, until I come unto my lord unto Seir.
verses.ct: "Please go on ahead of your servant, and I will move along slowly at a pace the livestock and the children can handle, until I reach my lord in Seir."

verses.kjv: And Esau said, Let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me. And he said, What needeth it? let me find grace in the sight of my lord.
verses.ct: Esau said, "Then at least let me leave some of my men with you." But Jacob replied, "There is no need for that. Just let me find grace in the sight of my lord."

verses.kjv: So Esau returned that day on his way unto Seir.
verses.ct: So Esau started back toward Seir that same day.

verses.kjv: And Jacob journeyed to Succoth, and built him an house, and made booths for his cattle: therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.
verses.ct: Jacob traveled to Succoth, where he built a house for himself and made shelters for his livestock. That is why the place is named Succoth.

verses.kjv: And Jacob came to Shalem, a city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Padanaram; and pitched his tent before the city.
verses.ct: Jacob arrived safely at the city of Shechem in the land of Canaan, on his journey from Padanaram, and he set up camp near the city.

verses.kjv: And he bought a parcel of a field, where he had spread his tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for an hundred pieces of money.
verses.ct: He purchased the piece of land where he had pitched his tent from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem, for a hundred pieces of money.

verses.kjv: And he erected there an altar, and called it EleloheIsrael.
verses.ct: He set up an altar there and named it EleloheIsrael.
